revised_title: Hugh Stott Taylor: A Life in Science and Service
tldr: The article is a biographical memoir of Hugh Stott Taylor, a prominent chemist known for his work in catalysis and surface chemistry. Taylor's life and career are detailed, from his early years in a family of scientists and educators to his time studying in Stockholm and Germany, and his later work at Princeton University and during World War I. His contributions to the fields of catalysis and surface chemistry, as well as his involvement in the church and his impact on the Princeton community, are highlighted.
